DOC.brief_summary: This cross-sectional longitudinal study evaluate image characteristic 18F-AV-1451 cognitively healthy volunteer , mild cognitive impairment ( MCI ) Alzheimer 's disease ( AD ) subject .
DOC.brief_title: Analysis 18F-AV-1451 PET Imaging Cognitively Healthy , MCI AD Subjects
DOC.criteria: Exploratory Cognitively Healthy Subjects ≥ 20 ≤ 40 year age OR ≥ 50 year age Minimental state examination ( MMSE ) ≥ 29 No significant history cognitive impairment Exploratory MCI Subjects ≥ 50 year age MMSE ≥ 24 Have MCI consistent National Institute AgingAlzheimer 's Association ( NIAAA ) work group 's diagnostic guideline AD Have study partner report subject 's activity daily live Exploratory AD Subjects ≥ 50 year age MMSE > 10 Have possible probable AD base NIAAA work group 's diagnostic guideline AD Have study partner report subject 's activity daily live Confirmatory Subjects ≥ 50 year age MMSE ≥ 20 ≤ 27 Cognitively impaired subject either MCI dementia suspect neurodegenerative cause Have study partner report subject 's activity daily live Current clinically significant psychiatric disease Evidence structural brain abnormality History moderate severe traumatic brain injury Current clinically significant cardiovascular disease ECG abnormalities , additional risk factor Torsades de Pointes Current clinically significant infectious disease , endocrine metabolic disease , pulmonary , renal hepatic impairment , cancer History alcohol substance abuse dependence Females childbearing potential surgically sterile , refrain sexual activity use reliable method contraception Have receive participated trial investigational medication past 30 day Have nonstudy related radiopharmaceutical imaging treatment procedure within 7 day prior study image session .
